intro: Arabis alpina var. parviflora, commonly known as the alpine rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, fleshy leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. Its flowers are borne on slender, branching stems and are often clustered in racemes. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens or alpine settings.
